Reviews.Title: “Great Staff and Good Value”
Reviews.Author: pattilca
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the RI Phoenix Airport for a business meeting in downtown Phoenix. The location is a bit far away from the center of downtown but it is easily accessible by the Light Rail. The rail is about 1/2 mile walk straight down the street from the hotel. When the shuttle was available the hotel offered to drop me off and pick me up from the rail station. The shuttle also dropped me off and picked me up from the airport, the zoo and the local walmart. All I had to do was call the desk and see if the driver was free or out on airport runs. They saved me a lot of cab fares! The rooms a little less updated than other Residence Inns I have stayed at but they were well stocked and clean. The breakfast was fine but not spectacular. The manger's receptions were a bit disappointing because the two receptions I was at were basically inedible except for the cookies and the beer and wine. The best part of the hotel was the staff. They were very friendly and helpful. They made my stay away from downtown center as easy as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: Pastorkenaz
Reviews.Content: attended a business meeting Thursday - Friday... check in was fast... the room really nice and my biggest fear (Jet noise) was relieved. Even through it near the airport I didn't hear a thing all night... the meeting were just as good... we never hear the airport. Great Business Hotel in Phoenix

Reviews.Title: “nice all around”
Reviews.Author: art89
Reviews.Content: We are Residence Inn fans, and this may have been a step above the typical. Quick shuttle to the airport. Very nice pool and hot tub. Cute open "mini rooms" adjacent to the dining area if you want some privacy for a small group of 4-6. Helpful front desk. A great idea that should be copied is their dining guide. They list the close restaurants in many categories, their distances, and then list the best in three different price ranges. What a great idea! We can vouch for the Chinese restaurant directly across the street.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel- great breakfast- wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: RobertandKate
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at this hotel a number of times/ love the fact that we can open the windows for fresh air/ shuttle service wonderfully helpful as well as the rest of the staff/ always cheerful and helpful/ breakfast buffet plentiful and very tasty including hot food choices that are prepared fresh each day/ beds compfortable/nice kitchen for long stays/ shuttle will take you to rail line nearby/ Really like this hotel especially the wonderfully cheerful and helpful staff/ to the manager- good hiring/ always have had a good sleep at this hotel/ hotel very clean - nice floral displays around the property and the pool looks nice/ Only weakness no restaurant on site and except for a couple of oriental restaurants across the street/ none really closeby- book as early as possible to get better rates/ less expensive on weekends

Reviews.Title: “not up to Marriott standards”
Reviews.Author: travelingmama52
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in many Marriott Residence Inns. This hotel was old & outdated, not a good value. Walls are in need of paint, furniture is old & uncomfortable. Towels & linens worn thin. Toilet needs replacing. The fluorescent lights were harsh & painful to the eyes. Bed was not queen size as advertised. Entire room was white-very bland & boring. TV's were nice. Location is good. But we would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: reviewnazi
Reviews.Content: Visited arizona for the grand canyon, sedona, and friends. Stayed here one night and I was very impressed. The pool was very nice and great for kids. The room was very big and comfortable. I had a very early flight so I had breakfast and the hotel was very nice to have a shuttle to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for airport”
Reviews.Author: USFlyBoy
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very close to Sky Harbor. Free breakfast and free manager's reception during the week. Good size room that was clean. Not many food choices within walking distance if you don't have a car.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Travelpirate89
Reviews.Content: This really is an ideal place to stay. Comfortable rooms with plenty of space and very well equiped. The staff are friendly and helpful and the breakfast is good. I simply can't fault this well appointed, excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Residence Inn!”
Reviews.Author: flygalaz
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this property while undergoing a remodel of our home. I was very satisfied with this stay especially as a mini home-away-from home. Plus: *Very clean rooms, great housekeeping. *Well equipped with everything you need. *Very safe and secure building, you have to have a key to get in any section where rooms are. *Free airport shuttle which will also take you to places in the near-by area. *Free grocery shopping service (no mark-up or delivery charges). *Good daily breakfasts with lots of choices. *Light snacks and drinks provided in evenings (although I wish they would offer it at least M-TH vs. just M-W) and the selections were rather limited but for a free snack, not bad. These days many of the other hotels who offer evening socials have more to offer but the fact they offer at all, why complain? *Free daily popcorn in room (microwave, all properties do this but I enjoy it). *2 Bedrooms have a fireplace (although you will need to get wood or a log for it). *Studios are very spacious (we started in a studio and moved to a 2 bedroom but the studio would be fine for most singles or couples, consider a 1 or 2 bedroom with family). *Nice heated pool and spa. *Decent gym (small but new equip and clean and bright) *Service (best thing about this hotel), the staff is awesome! *Pet friendly/accommodating. Even provide an area in which to relieve your pet that is well maintained. Great for us who needed this but something to consider for others who may not like staying at hotels that take pets. *Easy access to all major freeways, downtown, Tempe, Scottsdale, etc. The neighborhood is really not bad considering it’s near the airport (which can be iffy) but since it’s in a section with other hotels, restaurants and office buildings, it’s not bad. We walked out to eat a couple nights and felt safe but as in any city, use caution. *Large building but plenty of entrances (stairs and elevators) and they have large carts available to carry /wheel your things. *Windows that open (I love this in hotels). Things to Consider: *This property has not undergone the remodel several of the others have so the rooms are not as modern as other properties; however, Residence Inn tells me they will be starting their remodel in 2012. To me this was not a big deal, the rooms were still comfortable’ clean and everything was in working order. *Nice common areas, however only 1 shared PC for boarding passes, etc. so sometimes in the morning it gets busy but people were fairly courteous of this and front desk staff will offer to print your pass if needed. *Wireless Internet was so/so. In our first room it was iffy but the second was strong. Might depend on where the access points are. *Offers Dish Network, probably the base line up but fine for what we needed and flat screens in the rooms. Includes HBO. *If you stay in the back of the hotel (which seemed quieter in general) you face a parking lot and you sometimes hear the garbage trucks early (around 4 or 4:30am) dumping the bins. Same thing with you can hear trains in the distance (might be any room), however, this is not a huge deal but if a light sleeper, it might wake you. Otherwise, fairly quiet overall. In Conclusion: If you need some space, like the pluses of having a breakfast, and staying in a well run hotel, pick this. I don’t think you will be sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: Triplewin
Reviews.Content: This property is massive and difficult to navigate. Staff was fantastic, able to change my incorrectly booked reservation (my fault) and accommodate my stay. Rooms were typical RI, very large, well appointed with dining area, work station, couch and flat screen tv. Room was very clean and comfortable. HVAC worked fine without excessive noise. Room internet was spotty, but worked flawlessly in the lobby/common areas. Breakfast buffet was great, scrambled eggs, breakfast sandwiches.,.largest selection I have seen at any chain property. Again breakfast staff was helpful and eager to help. Shuttle to airport available and only a few minutes from the airport. Great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Residence Stay”
Reviews.Author: acoulter
Reviews.Content: Well trained staff, clean accommodations, moderately acceptable fitness room, decent breakfast offerings. Tyical Marriott site.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and a Good Value.”
Reviews.Author: TSchenk
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this location for a short business trip. The property is larger than most Residence Inn locations. The grounds are fully appointed and very clean and well maintained. I did have a bit of trouble finding the elevators as it is such a large property and all the halls look the same it made navigation a bit difficult. They do have multiple entries that allow you to park quite close to your room no matter where it is located. The breakfast is typical of this chain but this location I felt was a little above average in cleanliness and presentation. Overall, we had a comfortable stay at a very reasonable price. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but average at best”
Reviews.Author: TravlinTXFamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property during an overnight layover. It was clean as everyone here says. There were two large flat panel tv's and the staff was very friendly. The property is 10 minutes from the airport. I found the bed to be uncomfortable and the bathroom and kitchen areas felt dated and old. Our microwave didn't work. I would not stay at this property again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: the5kites
Reviews.Content: Super clean. The staff were always more than accomodating. Pool area was really clean and enjoyable to use for a family with younger kids. One of their "happy hour" type events had food and beverages for kids and adults. Saved us from having to cook dinner after a long day. Breakfast was great. Plenty of seating and more than enough food. A much nicer area than most. A short drive on the interstate from Banner Good Sumaritan Hospital and a much nicer area!

Reviews.Title: “Above all expectations”
Reviews.Author: Roch4909
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an excellent value for you money. Probably one of the cleaness hotel I've visited. The room was large and spotless. The hot breakfast (always included) was great and way above average. The pool was very clean with large clean towels available. Staff is very helpfull and you are always treated with a smile. Very convenient location, minutes away from the light rail station. The shuttle service is always on time. Iced water always available and hot coffee at night in the lobby. Good security since you need your keycard to access the floors. Highly recommanded.

Reviews.Title: “Business Trip”
Reviews.Author: SheilaandLee
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Residence Inn Phoenix Airport the first week of Aug 2011. The rooms were more than adequate and just as expected. Everything was clean and well kept. I was traveling on business and just like to come back to the room - make myself supper and do a little catch-up on emails from the day. By the time I crawl in bed, I just want to sleep and the beds at Marriott make this easy. I would recommend that you stay here if you need to be in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for an extended stay in Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: koho1954
Reviews.Content: Halfway through a two week stay for business in Phoenix, and I have to say, this is a great place to stay. Rooms are clean, beds comfy, staff friendly, and the jacuzzi is hot. Breakfast is hot and way above average for these places. good variety. The occasional "social" nights are fun too, and a great way to skip paying for an evening meal. If you do need a meal, Bobby Q's is just down the road. Access is interesting, but once you figure it out not a problem. RI sits on a one way frontage road, so you will be driving around the block when coming from the south. Butler street cuts through from 27th. Plenty of shopping close.

Reviews.Title: “The best we've stayed at”
Reviews.Author: ktsuruda
Reviews.Content: Spacious and clean. Mini kitchen with a refrigerator/freezer that provided our daily ice was a plus. Free hot breakfast was another plus. Convenient to many places and the airport!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay.”
Reviews.Author: KC710
Reviews.Content: Very helpful staff. Shuttle to airport and metro line. Easy access into downtown. Nice hearty breakfast each day. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Large room and Nice for the $s”
Reviews.Author: bstrvl55711
Reviews.Content: I didn't realize the Residence Inn formula when I booked. The rooms are larger than a regular hotel room (and actually less expensive). The Mariott a block away is 2X the cost. They have some freebies in the evening, but I did not partake. Good free wifi. Nice and quiet, easy to get to. Inside rooms. Did not try the gym (some great running spots in Phoenix). Just a couple of miles from museums and the zoo.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great staff, and super accommodations”
Reviews.Author: Manteo97
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights here, end of February, first of March. We wanted to stay near the airport, for a few days as we explored the Phoenix area with our rental car. The room was just like a cozy 1 bedroom apartment, complete with a kitchen and all utensils. There were BBQ's in the pool area that you could use too. Rooms were exceptional and relatively quit. Windows opened which is nice at this time of year. Breakfast (inclusive)was very nice, and the Manager's special at 6:00 pm was really a full dinner if you wanted it to be. Fantastic Chinese restaurant right across the street in the Chinese Cultural Center, and don't miss the Asian Supermarket there too. Outdoor pool is heated, and there is a hot tub. Hotel staff was exceptional , and very helpful. Airport Shuttle is available to go short distances to some of the attractions. Larry Turner, the G.M., was most accommodating and very helpful, as well as the other front desk staff and hospitality staff. Absolutely no hesitation to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient and altogether pleasant!”
Reviews.Author: RuHuNJ
Reviews.Content: There is a reason people go to chains, and this is a good example of why. Everything was just right at this Residence Inn and I would definitely return there when back in the area. Reasonably priced too.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, convenient location and good value for a stay in Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: JR-from-London
Reviews.Content: This is a good place to stay if you are spending some time in Phoenix. The rooms are spacious, quiet and extremely well equipped - you could easily entertain several people in your room. The front desk clerk was friendly and helpful each time we dealt with him. The breakfasts are good and there is a "happy hour" on some weeknights with generous servings of wine or beer. The pool is a bit small but is good for a splash about and the hot tub is good too, although the proximity of some rooms makes you feel you are sitting in a goldfish bowl. The location is good with some restaurants in walking distance, bus stops outside and the light rail is about 10 minutes walk. They have a very good dining guide, arranged by cuisine and style. The only niggle was that the wi-fi was fiddly to access and on one occasion I gave up as it vwas so slow. But you can access the internet and print stuff in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel change, for the better”
Reviews.Author: annade1
Reviews.Content: My co-worker and I were in town for a confernece and were staying a different hotel down the street that had been overbooked due to a computer system issue. They sent us to the Residence Inn by Marriott Phoenix Airport and paid for our first night, got us a great rate and we were very happy to have switched. The room was good, the hot breakfast was nice and free wi-fi is always appreciated. The staff was friendly and helpful. One area I would like to see changes in is the fitness area as it was small and only had 4 machines.

Reviews.Title: “Great business hotel and outstanding customer service”
Reviews.Author: Glen05
Reviews.Content: Checking in was fast and courteous. The hotel is clean and the rooms, for the most part, are very quiet. We were fortunate to stay on the nights that the hotel held evening socials (light meals, beer, wine) and it was nice to be able to meet casually with the others in our group. I forgot my Sony radio in the room when I left and the hotel just called to say they were sending via Fed Ex this afternoon. That level of customer service makes a big impression.

Reviews.Title: “Love staying at Residence Inn with our big family.”
Reviews.Author: wade17
Reviews.Content: Great shuttle service to and from airport. Shuttle driver VERY helpful with information about the area.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice.”
Reviews.Author: Claybow
Reviews.Content: I volunteered to give up my seat on a flight from PHX to Palm Springs. The only hitch was that the next available flight was the next day and I'd have to it stay the night. Not a major problem, but it's always stressful to change plans at the last minute. Fortunately, it couldn't have gone more smoothly. The airline put me up at the Residence Inn and it was great. The shuttle didn't take too long to pick me up and the driver was great. He had a couple of non-english speakers on board and he tried valiantly to answer their questions. The front desk staff (Brittany is the best!) was awesome. Extremely friendly and talkative and answered all my questions eagerly and patiently. Plus there was a happy hour with free beer and wine! I was amazed at the size of the room. Very spacious and well-appointed. AND very quiet. A major plus in my book. Checkout in the morning was smooth. And despite leaving before the scheduled start time of the hot breakfast, it was ready early and I got a nice bowl of oatmeal. Bonus: It was a very quick shuttle ride from the hotel to the airport. For an unexpected change in plans, my layover in Phoenix went as smoothly as it could have.

Reviews.Title: “Good option”
Reviews.Author: lsm112375
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice. First night Christmas night after flying into Phoenix from Florida, the other 6 nights later, the night before we flew home. Our main destination was Tucson, but this ended up being a good base for us while in the area. Arrived super late on Christmas night due to some chaos at the Phoenix airport and car rental counter (2 thumbs down to Hertz for this trip). Just happy to be getting to the room as we had an over tired 2 year old that needed to go to bed. Check-in was smooth and easy. My husband and I were traveling with my parents as well, and they put our rooms super close together and on the first floor, which was nice since we still had to bring all our bags in even though we were only staying for one night. Both times the room were clean and orderly. My son slept on the pull out sofa and they sheets for it were in the closet. I sat on it twice, and it didn't seem so bad. Hubby and I stayed in the Queen in the bedrrom (no Kings in any of the one bedroom room here). We are used to a King at home, so the quenn seemed a bit tight. Pillows were bad too, but mattress was fine. Heard a bit of noise through the bedroom wall into the adjacent room, but it went away quickly and we never heard them again. Breakfast was a typical Residence Inn. Nothing to rave about, but nothing to complain about either. The food is what it is, but at least the dining tables and food counters were clean. Front desk staff was friendly. On arrivel on Christmas night they knew which restaurant we could call for food (an Italian joint of some sort, which had decent sandwiches)- and where to direct us on the morning of the 26th to find the nearest drugstore for trip supplies (a new CVS right down the street). Do not know the costs since my parents were extremely generous and cashed in their hotel points for us to stay both times. If we were to return and the price was right, I would stay again. Also loved that the internet was free.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute perfect for business or vacation”
Reviews.Author: ForsthausWire
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a very good. Extra large rooms with full kitchen installed, clean bathroom, comfortable bed, clean carpets, very friendly staff, good sized clean pool area with lots of chairs around the pool, designated smoking area with chairs, great full hot breakfast buffet in the morning is also included. Also free WIFI internet access and free internet terminal in the lobby and there was even a free printer with paper available. The location is very close to Sky Harbor airport but still quiet. Very good access via freeways to downtown Phoenix and sightseeing in the area. We were almost blown away by the service, location and size of the rooms. We have not (yet) found a better deal in the Phoenix area.

Reviews.Title: “good airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: bettyUK
Reviews.Content: We had an overnight stay after our flight from the UK. We were a party of 5 and had booked a two bedroom suite, with my son sleeping on a sofa bed in the living area. Ir was reasonably compact, each bedroom having its own TV and bathroom. My son had to walk through our bedroom to get to the bathroom. The kitchen area was really nice to have. We bought reasonably priced snacks, milk and beer from the hotel. Buffet breakfast was a good spread. Our room was quiet although the aircon was noisy. We also used the airport shuttle to get from the airport and then to return to the airport to pick up our hirecar. That all went smoothly. The minivans seem to go at regular intervals.

Reviews.Title: “Professional front desk staff keeps me coming back”
Reviews.Author: cgerard
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this Residence Inn several times during the past two years. Aside from the proximity to the airport, the professionalism of the front desk staff keeps me coming back. They have always been prompt to acknowledge my presence at the desk, and courteous when getting me checked in and out no matter what time of day or night I show up, helpful for storing a bag, and with directions to a grocery or restaurant, The rooms have been very clean every time, beds have been extremely comfortable, and the prices reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but I could do better.”
Reviews.Author: gottamove34
Reviews.Content: Well, it's an easy place to find in relation to the airport. Nice parking lot with a nice sampling of cacti near the front of the building. Check-in was prompt, yet relaxed which was fine by me. My first problem was after checking in, I had to constantly use my room card. Within 30 feet, you'll need your card out for the back of the lobby, the pool, and the door to enter the building which has your room. I'd hate to see anyone with more than one bag deal with those doors. The room had everything I needed plus a good little kitchen. When I stay longer than two nights, I love to have more than just a little dorm-size fridge for some groceries. I found the role of housekeeping - in regards to the kitchen - to be confusing. Everything was nicely organized, but some stuff was half-washed and the rest was stuff I was going to wash and dry myself. Nonetheless, I made great use of my kitchen! The room had two big drawbacks. I probably would've found a better quality deal and the television looked like it was at the end of its depreciation. The nice part is that Marriott has always been good to me when it comes to comfortable beds and showers. That's usually why I'll choose Marriott first if I don't know the area well. The outdoor pool is surprisingly comfortable and provides the option of having your own little cookout. While the breakfast buffet food is average, it is well run. All in all, it was OK. Next time, I'll just stay downtown or in Scottsdale.

Reviews.Title: “Great Airport Hoetl”
Reviews.Author: travelgrl1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this property as we had an early morning flight. I have to say the staff was excellent. They are very well trained in service which I truly appreciate these days. The rooms were excellent as always- comfortable and well equipped. The only thing to be aware of is to be sure to bring your room key if you are walking from your room to the front desk since they will be in separate buildings and you must have your key to get back in your building. I left mine in the room with my husband while I went to the desk and could not get back into the building and had to knock on the window so he could let me back in . (Good thing we had a 1st floor room) The shuttle was right on time to the airport and even though breakfast did not start until 6am and our shuttle left at 530am- they still had hot coffee and juice out and fresh fruit so we could grab something before going to the airport. I would definitely stay here again. I am a travel agent so I get good rates at Marriott anyway, but this property stuck out due to the service of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: Algood
Reviews.Content: We were able to check in (very) early. Staff was very friendly. Upon entering our room, we noticed that our bed was not done completely with pillows missing. It took no more than 5 minutes after calling, for the staff to come and make the bed. Later on we received a note form the front desk apologizing for this and a small bag of goodies. We thought it was a very thoughtful gesture. Breakfast is the usual, nothing extra ordinary. Location is great. Airport, car rental and highway is very close. There are a bunch of Chinese restaurants that are good right across from the hotel (can walk) Will definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for business!”
Reviews.Author: twashing
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on business for 3 nights and found it to be excellent. The staff is very professional, and always greeted me with a smile. The business facilites are excellent, and the rooms perfect for working late into the night. The free airport shuttle made it a simple task to get in and out of quickly. The only thing I didn't like was the surly attitude at their restaurant, and the mediocre food, but there were many options close by, so that was not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but at a price”
Reviews.Author: finickytripper
Reviews.Content: For 15,000 Marriott Rewards points, this excellent facility was a very pleasant steal for me. But without points, I would have paid $269/night plus taxes and other fees, and I'd probably be a little more critical. The rooms are recently updated with generally quality materials and good lighting everywhere. Both the rooms and common areas were very clean and quiet during my stay. The buffet breakfast was a touch bigger and tastier than I've had at recent other Residence Inn stays. The Internet service in the common area was well-equipped and sufficient for efficiently printing out boarding passes, checking the news, and the like. The front desk staff was efficient and helpful, but one or two of the staff were somewhat aloof and impolite, while another manager was very friendly. The free airport shuttle was on time, convenient and speedy, although the front desk mumbled something about possibly competing for shuttle space with hotel employees on certain shuttles during the week. I didn't have the time to use the other amenities, but others seemed to enjoy the hot tub, the fitness center is advertised as 24 hours, and several other typical Residence services are available. I've stayed at a fair number of Residence Inns and Courtyards, and this was one of the nicest, especially using points.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Chinese Food Across the Street!”
Reviews.Author: retro1959
Reviews.Content: I am a buisness traveler looking for cleanliness and competent staff in a hotel. This hotel meets my needs and therefore I have come back several times. The rooms are large and comfortable, and very well kept. The breakfast area is pleasant but gets very busy, so come down a bit earlier than you planned if it's during "peak" period. One of the built-in bonuses of this hotel is that it is directly across the road from the Chinese Cultural Center. The bulk of the "center" is a shopping area for Chinese-American stores and restaurants, and all of them are good -- and very reasonably priced. I have tried a few of them on different visits. If you walk across, remember that Phoenix drivers don't know the meaning of the word "pedestrian" and you must be very, very careful crossing the high-speed traffic to get to the center. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in Residence Inn”
Reviews.Author: cchicks4
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in March. The room was near the laundry room which had a horrible odor. The bed was uncomfortable and we did not have enough towels. Hotel was overpriced for $139 per night We had read the previous reviews and expected much more. We were disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I don't know how this stay could have been better except if I had stayed longer. Everything about this place was great - extra large room with kitchen and wireless office facilities and a fabulous breakfast. Other hotels should take a queue from this hotel on how to do a breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place for a Night or Two”
Reviews.Author: Thor1999
Reviews.Content: This Residence Inn is well located not far from the airport. The facility is well kept and the rooms are clean and well maintained. The kitchen facilities are lacking, however, so if you plan on staying for more than a day or two, don't plan on cooking much. The front desk staff was friendly and tried to be helpful, but was unable to give driving directions to a local restaurant, which I found by asking a policeman later in the day.

HotelInfo.Name: Residence Inn Phoenix Airport
HotelInfo.Address: 801 North 44th Street, Phoenix, AZ 85008
